description: Enterprise techniques used by FIN5, ATT&CK group G0053 v1.0
name: FIN5 (G0053)

techniques.comment: [FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) maintains access to victim environments by using [Valid Accounts](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1078) to access [External Remote Services](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1133) as well as establishing a backup RDP tunnel by using [FLIPSIDE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0173).
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) uses [SDelete](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0195) to clean up the environment and attempt to prevent detection.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) has used the open source tool Essential NetTools to map the network and build a list of targets.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) has used legitimate VPN, RDP, Citrix, or VNC credentials to maintain access to a victim environment.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) has dumped credentials from victims. Specifically, the group has used the tool GET5 Penetrator to look for remote login and hard-coded credentials.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) has cleared event logs from victims.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) scripts save memory dump data into a specific directory on hosts in the victim environment.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) scans processes on all victim systems in the environment and uses automated scripts to pull back the results.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) has used legitimate VPN, Citrix, or VNC credentials to maintain access to a victim environment.
[FIN5](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0053) scans processes on all victim systems in the environment and uses automated scripts to pull back the results.
